intro: Pimpinella procumbens, commonly known as匍匐茴香, is a low-growing annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, green, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp, which splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. Pimpinella procumbens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in dry, sunny conditions.
